item.title: Etcetera add a quote by Julio Cortázar
item.description: "Nada está perdido si se tiene el valor de proclamar que todo está perdido y hay que empezar de nuevo." -- Julio Cortázar

item.title: Etcetera add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "The only sin is the sin of being born" -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Etcetera add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I don't know the question, but sex is definitely the answer." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Etcetera add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I had a terrible education. I attended a school for emotionally disturbed teachers." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Etcetera add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I asked the girl if she could bring a sister for me. She did. Sister Maria Teresa. It was a very slow evening. We discussed the New Testament. We agreed that He was very well adjusted for an only child." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Etcetera add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "He is ugly and sad... but he is all love." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Etcetera add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "If I knew that today would be the last time I’d see you, I would hug you tight and pray the Lord be the keeper of your soul. If I knew that this would be the last time you pass through this door, I’d embrace you, kiss you, and call you back for one more. If I knew that this would be the last time I would hear your voice, I’d take hold of each word to be able to hear it over and over again. If I knew this is the last time I see you, I’d tell you I love you, and would not just assume foolishly you know it already." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Etcetera add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "To fear love is to fear life, and those who fear life are already 3-parts dead." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Etcetera add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "War does not determine who is right - only who is left." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Etcetera add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "I do not pretend to be able to prove that there is no God. I equally cannot prove that Satan is a fiction. The Christian god may exist; so may the gods of Olympus, or of ancient Egypt, or of Babylon. But no one of these hypotheses is more probable than any other: they lie outside the region of even probable knowledge, and therefore there is no reason to consider any of them." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Etcetera add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "My desire and wish is that the things I start with should be so obvious that you wonder why I spend my time stating them. This is what I aim at because the point of philosophy is to start with something so simple as not to seem worth stating, and to end with something so paradoxical that no one will believe it." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Etcetera add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "And if there were a God, I think it very unlikely that He would have such an uneasy vanity as to be offended by those who doubt His existence" -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Etcetera add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "Really high-minded people are indifferent to happiness, especially other people's." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Etcetera add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "I would never die for my beliefs because I might be wrong." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Etcetera add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "One of the symptoms of an approaching nervous breakdown is the belief that one’s work is terribly important." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Etcetera add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "The hardest thing to learn in life is which bridge to cross and which to burn." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Etcetera add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "So far as I can remember there is not one word in the Gospels in praise of intelligence." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Etcetera add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "The secret of happiness is this: let your interest be as wide as possible and let your reactions to the things and persons who interest you be as far as possible friendly rather than hostile. " -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Etcetera add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "Life is nothing but a competition to be the criminal rather than the victim." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Etcetera add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "I say people who feel they must have a faith or religion in order to face life are showing a kind of cowardice, which in any other sphere would be considered contemptible. But when it is in the religious sphere it is thought admirable, and I cannot admire cowardice whatever sphere it is in." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Etcetera add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "I believe that when I die I shall rot, and nothing of my ego will survive." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Etcetera add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "No man treats a motorcar as foolishly as he treats another human being. When the car will not go, he does not attribute its annoying behavior to sin; he does not say, 'You are a wicked motorcar, and I shall not give you any more petrol until you go.' He attempts to find out what is wrong and to set it right." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Etcetera add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "If the ordinary wage-earner worked four hours a day, there would be enough for everybody and no unemployment -- assuming a certain very moderate amount of sensible organization. This idea shocks the well-to-do, because they are convinced that the poor would not know how to use so much leisure. In America men often work long hours even when they are well off; such men, naturally, are indignant at the idea of leisure for wage-earners, except as the grim punishment of unemployment; in fact, they dislike leisure even for their sons." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Etcetera add a quote by Yukio Mishima
item.description: "Perfect purity is possible if you turn your life into a line of poetry written with a splash of blood." -- Yukio Mishima

item.title: Etcetera add a quote by Yukio Mishima
item.description: "When a captive lion steps out of his cage, he comes into a wider world than the lion who has known only the wilds. While he was in captivity, there were only two worlds for him - the world of the cage, and the world outside the cage. Now he is free. He roars. He attacks people. He eats them. Yet he is not satisfied, for there is no third world that is neither the world of the cage nor the world outside the cage." -- Yukio Mishima
